column1: Macros may be enabled globally for all Excel Workbooks, or on an individual workbook by workbook basis.  This tutorial will explain how to configure each of these options for Excel 2007 and Excel 2010.  If you are using an earlier version of Excel (97, 2000, XP, 2003) or a version later than 2010, you will need to consult the Excel Help files to determine how to configure Excel so that macros are enabled.
Enabling Macros for all Workbooks in Excel 2007

column2: With Excel 2007 open, click the Microsoft Office Button as illustrated below.  (The procedures for Excel 2010 are nearly identical except that "Excel Options" is a menu choice under the "File" menu.
Click on the "Excel Options" button as illustrated below.
In the Excel Options dialog box (illustrated below), select the "Trust Center" option.
Click on the "Trust Center Settings" button that appears (illustrated below).
Select the "Macro Settings" option in the Trust Center dialog box (illustrated below).
Select the "Enable all macros" option, illustrated below, then click the "OK" button to enable macros in all workbook……………

column1: Please Note that enabling macros in all workbooks may violate your corporate policies or expose you computer to risks that you would rather not accept.  If this is the case, please see "Enabling Macros for the Current Workbook in Excel 2007 and Excel 2010" section.
Enabling Macros for the Current Workbook in Excel 2007 and Excel 2010

column2: Open an Excel workbook that contains macros (identified with the file extension .xlsm in Excel 2007 and 2001, however older versions of Excel use the .xls extension.)

Look for the Security Warning (illustrated below) immediately above the worksheet that is displayed.  Click its "Options…" button.  (The background color of this warning message will be different in Excel 2010, but the message and button will otherwise be identical.)
Select the "Enable this content" in the Security Alert dialog box, as illustrated below.

column1: Please Note for the security warning to appear when a workbook containing macros is opened, the "Disable all macros with warnings" option must be selected in the Macro Settings dialog box (illustrated above).  Also, it will be necessary to individually enable macros in every macro-enabled workbook that is opened in Excel.
